document.masterDocTitle: New species and new records of predaceous midges in the genera, Schizonyxhelea Clastrier and Stilobezzia Kieffer from Mexico (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and new records of predaceous midges in the genera, Schizonyxhelea Clastrier and Stilobezzia Kieffer from Mexico (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Adult
Stilobezzia
of Mexico

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Wing with 1 radial cell; fore femur with 2–4 stout black ventral spines...........
S . ( Eukraiohelea ) elegantula (Johannsen)
- Wing with 2 radial cells; fore femur without ventral spines.....................................................3

4 Scutellum yellow on mid portion; wing hyaline..............................................
S . ( A .) fuscula Wirth

- Scutellum dark brown; wing infuscated ( Fig. 17 )............................................
S . ( A .) spinellii
,
n. sp.
- Wing hyaline or infuscated, without dark spots on anterior margin..............................................10
6 Fore tibia with numerous small dark spots; scutum with short anterior tubercle..................................... 7
- Fore tibia without numerous small dark spots; scutum with or without anterior tubercle........................... … 8

7 Wing with 2 dark spots, on r-m crossvein and very small one at base of 2nd radial cell.................
S . ( S .) kiefferi Lane

- Wing with 3 dark spots, on r-m crossvein, and 2 others at base and apex of 2nd radial cell...........
S . ( S .) punctulata Lane

8 Mesonotum yellow, without anterior tubercle; wing hyaline, with distinct brown spots on r-m crossvein and at level of 2nd radial cell; legs yellow, narrow apices of hind femur and tibia brown..........................
S . ( S .) coquilletti Kieffer

- Mesonotum brown, with anterior tubercle; wing brownish, anterior margin with 2 or 3 dark spots; legs with extensive brown bands............................................................................................... 9

9 Fifth tarsomeres with ventral batonnets; wing with 3 dark spots, including 1 on apex of 2nd radial cell....
S . ( S .) rabelloi Lane

- Fifth tarsomeres without ventral batonnets; wing with 2 dark wing spots, none on apex of 2nd radial cell..
S . ( S .) beckae Wirth

11 Mid femur blackish on proximal 2/3; abdomen shining black.........................
S . ( S .) femoralis Lane & Forattini

12 Femora, tibiae whitish, hind femur with faint dark apical band..................................
S . ( S .) glauca Macfie

- Femora, tibiae yellowish, hind femur with solid dark apical band...............................
S . ( S .) maculata Lane

13 Mesonotum dark brown, with large pruinose gray spots; tibiae with sub-basal pale bands..............
S . ( S .) hirta Borkent

- Mesonotum uniform light grayish brown without spots; tibiae without bands...............
S . ( S .) pallidiventris (Malloch)

14 Wing with 1 radial cell; fifth tarsomeres with ventral batonnets; fore femur with 3–4 ventral spines..........................................................................................
S . ( Eukraiohelea ) elegantula (Johannsen)
- Wing with 2 radial cells; fifth tarsomeres with or without ventral batonnets; fore femur without ventral spines...........15
16 Fore tibia with numerous small dark spots; scutum with short anterior tubercle.................................... 17
- Fore tibia without numerous dark spots; scutum with or without anterior tubercle..................................18

17 Aedeagus with an oblique pair of doubly sinuate sclerites with sickle-shaped apices; parameres with slender tapered apices that are abruptly bent ventrocephalad..........................................................
S . ( S .) kiefferi Lane

- Aedeagus with a pair of dark brown lateral sclerites with pointed tips; parameres separate with 2 elongate sclerites with sharply pointed apices that are posteriorly directed................................................
S . ( S .) punctulata Lane

18 Hind tibia with stout, black setae on dorsal surface; parameres with a pair of basolateral L-shaped sclerites.....................................................................................................
S . ( S .) rabelloi Lane
- Hind tibia without stout, black setae on dorsal surface; parameres without a pair of basolateral L-shaped sclerites........19

19 Legs yellow, narrow apices of hind femur and tibia brown; aedeagal sclerites with rounded apices...
S . ( S .) coquilletti Kieffer

- Legs dark brown, hind femur with narrow subapical lighter band; aedeagal sclerites with slender apices that are recurved 120̊, tips pointed..........................................................................
S . ( S .) beckae Wirth

21 Gonocoxite with an elongate black spine on mesal margin; parameres with apices gradually narrowed to fine apical filaments that are recurved......................................................................
S. ( A .) fuscula Wirth

- Gonocoxite without an elongate black spine on mesal margin; parameres with distal portions broad, straight, apicolateral mar- gins spoon-like ( Figs. 21, 23 )...........................................................
S. ( A .) spinellii
,
n. sp.
22 Abdomen with distinctive dark stripes on tergites 4–5 or single dark band on 5.................................... 23
- Abdomen without distinctive dark markings on tergites.......................................................24

23 Aedeagus with an oblique pair of long, straight, slender, sclerotized bars..........................
S . ( S .) glauca Macfie

- Aedeagus with oblique pair of sclerotized bars, apices gradually narrowed to a fine apical filament.....
S . ( S .) maculata Lane

24 Abdomen shining black; hind femur black........................................
S . ( S .) femoralis Lane & Forattini
- Abdomen yellow or pale; hind femur yellow or pale brown...................................................25

25 Gonostylus tapering distally to slender pointed tip....................................
S . ( S .) pallidiventris (Malloch)

- Gonostylus not tapered, with broad rounded apex.............................................
S . ( S .) hirta Borkent
